post.description:
## Overview
Create a new booking (appointment or event attendance). Available for **Staff, Directory, and Application tokens**.

**Important**: Always provide `client_id` parameter. Without it, the endpoint attempts to create a client from form_data and returns 'First name can't be blank' errors.

## Token Authorization
- **Staff tokens**: Client must belong to the same business as the staff member
- **Directory tokens**: Business must be a member of the directory (requires directory_member record)

## Booking Types
This endpoint supports two types of bookings with different required parameters:

### Appointment Booking (default)
When `event_instance_id` is NOT provided:
- **Required**: `business_id`, `service_id`, `staff_id`
- **Required one of**: `start_time` OR `optional_times`

### Event Registration
When `event_instance_id` IS provided:
- **Required**: `business_id`, `event_instance_id`

## Client Identification
- Use `client_id` to book for an existing client (required for Staff/App tokens)
- Without `client_id`, the endpoint expects form_data for client creation (used by client-facing booking flows)

arrival_window_value.description: Optional for appointment only. Arrival window value is in minutes and limited to 540 (9 hours).

client_id.description: Client uid. Recommended when booking on behalf of a client via Staff/App tokens.

event_instance_id.description: Event instance uid. Required for event registration (mutually exclusive with service_id/staff_id/start_time).

interaction_details.description: Address. Required when service location is set to: Client will set the address at booking.

matter_uid.description: Matter/conversation uid to associate with the booking.

service_id.description: Service uid. Required for appointment booking.

staff_id.description: Staff uid who will provide the service. Required for appointment booking.

start_time.description: ISO 8601 format datetime. Required for appointment booking (alternative: optional_times).

time_zone.description: Time zone for the booking. Default is UTC if not provided.

400.description: Parameter Missing - Required parameters not provided based on booking type

application/json.error: Mandatory parameter service_id is missing, Mandatory parameter staff_id is missing

422.description: Booking Creation Failure or Authorization Error

value.error: The requested time slot is not available

directory_unauthorized.summary: Directory token - business not in directory

post.description:
## Overview
Accept a pending booking. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Batch Operations
Supports batch operations by providing an array of booking IDs (max 50).

## Response
Returns the accepted booking details for single booking, or batch response for array of bookings.

booking_id.description: Booking (appointment/event) UID. Can be a single string or array of strings for batch operations (max 50).

event_instance_id.description: Event instance UID. Provide this when accepting an event registration rather than an appointment.

message.description: Optional message to include with the acceptance notification.

403.description: Forbidden - Too many bookings in batch request or operation not permitted

put.description:
## Overview
Cancel an existing booking. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Batch Operations
Supports batch operations by providing an array of booking IDs (max 50).

## Parameters
- `cancel_payment`: Set to true to cancel any associated payment
- `issue_refund`: Set to true to issue a refund for the cancelled booking

booking_id.description: Booking (appointment/event) UID. Can be a single string or array of strings for batch operations (max 50).

event_instance_id.description: Event instance UID. Provide this when cancelling an event registration rather than an appointment.

message.description: Optional message to include with the cancellation notification.

cancel_payment.description: Set to true to cancel any associated payment.

issue_refund.description: Set to true to issue a refund for the cancelled booking.

post.description:
## Overview
Mark a booking as completed or no-show. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Batch Operations
Supports batch operations by providing an array of booking IDs (max 50).

## Parameters
- `booking_id` (required): Single booking UID or array of UIDs for batch operations
- `business_id` (required): Business UID
- `mark_as_no_show`: Set to `true` to mark as no-show instead of completed
- `message`: Optional message to include with the completion notification
- `follow_up_params`: Optional parameters for sending a follow-up email

booking_id.description: Booking UID. Can be a single string or an array of strings for batch operations (max 50 bookings).

mark_as_no_show.description: Set to true to mark as no-show instead of completed. Default is false.

message.description: Optional message to include with the completion notification.

follow_up_params.description: Optional parameters for sending a follow-up email after completion.

put.description:
## Overview
Update booking details including start time, staff, and notes. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

**Note**: The path parameter is `booking_id` (not `booking_uid`).

parameters.description: Booking (appointment/event) ID. Obtained from create booking response.
parameters.name: booking_id

allow_double_booking.description: Should allow overlapping with a different booking if time/duration is changed (True by default)

auto_follow_up_hours.description: How many hours after the booking to send the automatic follow up message

interaction_details.description: Details of the meeting (address/ phone number

meeting_reminder_sms_1.description: Should send the client an SMS with the first reminder

meeting_reminder_sms_2.description: Should send the client an SMS with the second reminder

message.description: A message to be sent to the client after updating the booking

notify_client.description: If true a message about the update with the 'message' field would be sent to the client

padding.description: The padding duration before of the booking

remind_before_in_hours_1.description: How many hours before the booking to send the first reminder

remind_before_in_hours_2.description: How many hours before the booking to send the second reminder

sms_booking_confirmation.description: Should send the client an SMS with the booking confirmation

start_time.description: The start time of the booking in UTC (ISO 8601 format)'

put.description:
## Overview
Bulk create or update external calendar items. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook).

## Required Fields
- Provide exactly one of: `external_item` (single item) or `external_items` (array)
- Each item must include: `external_id`, `start_date`, `end_date`, `last_modification`

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

external_item.description: Single external item to create/update. Use this OR `external_items`, not both.

end_date.description: End date in ISO 8601 format. Required.

external_id.description: External system ID for the item. Required.

last_modification.description: Last modification timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Required.

rrule.description: Array of recurrence rules (RFC 5545 RRULE format)

start_date.description: Start date in ISO 8601 format. Required.

external_items.description: Array of external items to create/update. Use this OR `external_item`, not both.

end_date.description: End date in ISO 8601 format. Required.

external_id.description: External system ID for the item. Required.

last_modification.description: Last modification timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Required.

rrule.description: Array of recurrence rules (RFC 5545 RRULE format)

start_date.description: Start date in ISO 8601 format. Required.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Staff not registered to calendar sync

errors.message: staff is not registered to any calendar sync

put.summary: External app bulk create external items

put.description:
## Overview
Bulk deactivate external calendar items. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook).

## Required Fields
- `external_items_to_deactivate` must be an array
- Each item must include `external_id`

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

external_items_to_deactivate.description: Array of external items to deactivate. Each item must include `external_id`.

external_id.description: External system ID of the item to deactivate. Required.

put.summary: External app bulk deactivate external items

put.description:
## Overview
Connect a staff member's calendar to an external calendar provider. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook).

## Response
Returns the calendar sync configuration including the `uid` which can be used as `external_calendar_uid` for other operations.

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Staff not registered to calendar sync

errors.message: staff is not registered to any calendar sync

put.description:
## Overview
Deactivate a specific external calendar. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisites
The `external_calendar_uid` is returned in the response when calling the `/v1/external_calendar_items/connect` endpoint.

external_calendar_uid.description: External Calendar UID. Obtained from the connect endpoint response.

put.description:
## Overview
Disable calendar sync for a staff member. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook). Then connect via `/connect` endpoint.

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

put.description:
## Overview
Disconnect a staff member's calendar from an external calendar provider. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook). Then connect via `/connect` endpoint.

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

put.description:
## Overview
Report the sync status after completing a calendar sync operation. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Required Fields
- `params.is_sync_successful` is required
- If `unsynced_items` is provided, each item must have `entity_uid`
- If `unsynced_calendars` is provided, each item must have `imported_calendar_name`

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

params.description: Status report of the sync operation.

is_sync_successful.description: Whether the sync was successful. Required.

unsynced_calendars.description: Array of calendars that failed to sync. Each item requires `imported_calendar_name`.

imported_calendar_name.description: The calendar's name. Required when item is present.

unsynced_items.description: Array of items that failed to sync. Each item requires `entity_uid`.

entity_uid.description: The entity UID of the unsynced item. Required when item is present.

put.description:
## Overview
Start exporting vcita calendar events to an external calendar. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook). Then connect via `/connect` endpoint.

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

put.description:
## Overview
Stop importing events from an external calendar. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisite
**Staff member must have a CalendarSync record** (typically created via the vcita web UI or OAuth flow with an external calendar provider like Google or Outlook). Then connect via `/connect` endpoint.

calendar_sync.description: Calendar sync configuration. Both `provider` and `account` are required.

account.description: The email account to sync to (e.g., user@gmail.com). Required.

post.description:
## Overview
General availability - Create new time slot. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

## Prerequisites
You need a `weekly_availability_uid` which can be obtained from the staff or service availability settings.

day.description: A number representing the day of the week (0 = Sunday, 6 = Saturday).

weekly_availability_uid.description: Weekly availability UID. Obtain from staff or service availability settings.

post.summary: General availability - Create new time slot

delete.description:
## Overview
General availability - Remove time slot Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

put.description:
## Overview
General availability - Update time slot. Available for **Staff and App tokens**.

scopes.business/scheduling: All scheduling related operations from the business side

Bearer.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'
